title: 1 oz American Palladium Eagle $25 .9995 Fine (Random Date)
description: The 1 oz American Palladium Eagle, bearing the distinguished Mercury design, stands as a testament to the U.S. Mint's commitment to excellence in both craftsmanship and metal purity. Struck in .9999 fine palladium, this coin weighs a substantial one troy ounce and holds a face value of $25. The obverse draws inspiration from Adolph A. Weinman's classic Winged Liberty (or "Mercury") design, initially seen on the U.S. dime in the early 20th century, showcasing Lady Liberty donning a winged Phrygian cap. The reverse, also a Weinman creation, presents a magnificent eagle perched atop a rock, echoing motifs of American freedom and strength. With each coin potentially hailing from various years of issue, collectors and investors alike appreciate the blend of historical artistry and tangible asset value. When ordered, the specific date received will be based on available inventory, making each acquisition a unique experience rooted in the rich tapestry of American numismatic heritage.

title: South African Gold Krugerrand 1 oz Coin Random Date
description: The South African Gold Krugerrand 1 oz is one of the most iconic and widely recognized gold bullion coins in the world. Introduced in 1967, it was the first modern bullion coin and played a significant role in popularizing gold ownership for private individuals. The coin contains 1 troy ounce of 22-karat gold, with a purity of 91.67% (or 22 parts gold and 2 parts copper). The obverse of the Krugerrand features the portrait of Paul Kruger, the former president of the South African Republic, while the reverse showcases a springbok antelope, a national symbol of South Africa. The coin's distinctive reddish-gold color is a result of the alloy used in its production. The South African Gold Krugerrand 1 oz offers investors a trusted and highly liquid option to own a piece of gold history, symbolizing the country's rich heritage and its enduring value as a tangible asset. This item may have a varied date depending on avalibility.
